 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }

 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;

    background: 0;

          </button>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    Shift-O<kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span         This bug requires manual review: M88's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: M88's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on:         ricea@ re <span class="line"><!---->ricea@ re <!----></span>#c13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c13"><!---->#c13<!----></a> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<span class="line"><!----> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<span class="line"><!---->Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<!----></span><br>Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<span class="line"><!---->Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<!----></span><br>This blog describes a similar exploit : <span class="line"><!---->This blog describes a similar exploit : <!----></span>https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/"><!---->https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"     <mr-error hidden=""><!----><!----></mr-error>
        
          
       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>
    Send email<chops-checkbox id="sendEmail">Send email</chops-checkbox>
          
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Discard
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Save changes
            <chops-button id="save" class="emphasized">
              Save changes
            </chops-button>
          <div>
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button id="save" class="emphasized">
              Save changes
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        <div class="edit-controls">
          <chops-checkbox id="sendEmail">Send email</chops-checkbox>
          <div>
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button id="save" class="emphasized">
              Save changes
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;

          padding: 0;

          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;

          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }

            flex-direction: column;

            min-height: 0;

          }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1151298%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D5300" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1151298%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D5300%252526ust%25253D1703414469120409%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw0xYIH--ZXlfYgEqjMYVhl3%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>
      
        <div class="container-outside" id="issue">
          <aside class="metadata-container">
            <mr-issue-metadata></mr-issue-metadata>
          </aside>
          <div class="container-issue">
            <div class="issue-header-container">
              <mr-issue-header></mr-issue-header>

              <mr-migrated-banner hidden=""></mr-migrated-banner>
            </div>
            <div class="container-issue-content">
              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {

          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
</script>

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {

      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;

                    ?<kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                show this help dialog<span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>

                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>

                  <!---->:

              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->

                  <!---->

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

<!----></span><br><br>I tested the asan-linux-release-812852 chrome.<span class="line"><!---->I tested the asan-linux-release-812852 chrome.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b         Interesting. I think we can copy the input data before the enqueue if and only if there are still bytes left to process. This will avoid the overhead of copying in the normal case.<span class="line"><!---->Interesting.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539<!----></a><br>Commit-Queue: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a         ricea@ re <span class="line"><!---->ricea@ re <!----></span>#c13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c13"><!---->#c13<!----></a> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<span class="line"><!----> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<span class="line"><!---->Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd"><!---->849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Sat Jan 09 20:35:34 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Sat Jan 09 20:35:34 2021<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank"
