      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/compression/deflate_transformer.cc;l=55<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/compression/deflate_transformer.cc;l=55"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/compression/deflate_transformer.cc;l=55<!----></a><br>ScriptPromise DeflateTransformer::Transform(<span class="line"><!---->ScriptPromise DeflateTransformer::Transform(<!----></span><br>    v8::Local<v8::Value> chunk,<span class="line"><!---->    v8::Local&lt;v8::Value&gt; chunk,<!----></span><br>    TransformStreamDefaultController* controller,<span class="line"><!---->    TransformStreamDefaultController* controller,<!----></span><br>    ExceptionState& exception_state) {<span class="line"><!---->    ExceptionState&amp; exception_state) {<!----></span><br>  ArrayBufferOrArrayBufferView buffer_source;<span class="line"><!---->  ArrayBufferOrArrayBufferView buffer_source;<!----></span><br>  V8ArrayBufferOrArrayBufferView::ToImpl(<span class="line"><!---->  V8ArrayBufferOrArrayBufferView::ToImpl(<!----></span><br>      script_state_->GetIsolate(), chunk, buffer_source,<span class="line"><!---->      script_state_-&gt;GetIsolate(), chunk, buffer_source,<!----></span><br>      UnionTypeConversionMode::kNotNullable, exception_state);<span class="line"><!---->      UnionTypeConversionMode::kNotNullable, exception_state);<!----></span><br>  if (exception_state.HadException()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (exception_state.HadException()) {<!----></span><br>    return ScriptPromise();<span class="line"><!---->    return ScriptPromise();<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br> class="line"><!---->		} catch(e) {<!----></span><br>			console.log("free");<span class="line"><!---->			console.log("free");<!----></span><br>		}<span class="line"><!---->		}<!----></span><br>	}});<span class="line"><!---->	}});<!----></span><br>	var input = new Uint8Array(ab);<span class="line"><!---->	var input = new Uint8Array(ab);<!----></span><br>	console.log(ab.length);<span class="line"><!---->	console.log(ab.length);<!----></span><br>	const cs = new CompressionStream('deflate');<span class="line"><!---->	const cs = new CompressionStream('deflate');<!----></span><br>	const writer = cs.writable.getWriter();<span class="line"><!---->	const writer = cs.writable.getWriter();<!----></span><br>	writer.write(input);<span class="line"><!---->	writer.write(input);<!----></span><br>	writer.close();<span class="line"><!---->	writer.close();<!----></span><br>	const output = [];<span class="line"><!---->	const output = [];<!----></span><br>	const reader = cs.readable.getReader();<span reader.read();<span class="line"><!---->	var { value, done } = await reader.read();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>main();<span class="line"><!---->main();<!----></span><br></script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>randomfile.py<span class="line"><!---->randomfile.py<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>with open('/dev/urandom', 'rb') as f:<span class="line"><!---->with open('/dev/urandom', 'rb') as f:<!----></span><br>    random = f.read(0x40000)<span class="line"><!---->    random = f.read(0x40000)<!----></span><br>with open('./random', 'wb') as f:<span class="line"><!---->with open('./random',         Interesting. I think we can copy the input data before the enqueue if and only if there are still bytes left to process.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539<a class="undefined" target="_blank" Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br><br>Yes.<span class="line"><!---->Yes.<!----></span><br><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br><br>No (removing request for M-87).<span class="line"><!---->No (removing request for M-87).<!----></span><br><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br><br>High severity security fix.<span class="line"><!---->High severity security fix.<!----></span><br><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br><br>No.<span class="line"><!---->No.<!----></span><br><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>N/A<span class="line"><!---->N/A<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         ricea@ re <span class="line"><!---->ricea@ re <!----></span>#c13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c13"><!---->#c13<!----></a> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<span class="line"><!----> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<span class="line"><!---->Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<!----></span><br>Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<span class="line"><!---->Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<!----></span><br>This blog describes a similar exploit : <span class="line"><!---->This blog describes a similar exploit : <!----></span>https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/"><!---->https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539<a class="undefined" target="_blank" class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

 fd<!----></span><br>  Stack left redzone:      f1<span class="line"><!---->  Stack left redzone:      f1<!----></span><br>  Stack mid redzone:       f2<span class="line"><!---->  Stack mid redzone:       f2<!----></span><br>  Stack right redzone:     f3<span class="line"><!---->  Stack right redzone:     f3<!----></span><br>  Stack after return:      f5<span class="line"><!---->  Stack after return:      f5<!----></span><br>  Stack use after scope:   f8<span class="line"><!---->  Stack use after scope:   f8<!----></span><br>  Global redzone:          f9<span class="line"><!---->  Global redzone:          f9<!----></span><br>  Global init order:       f6<span class="line"><!---->  Global init order:       f6<!----></span><br>  Poisoned by user:        f7<span class="line"><!---->  Poisoned by user:        f7<!----></span><br>  Container overflow:      fc<span class="line"><!---->  Container overflow:      fc<!----></span><br>  Array cookie:            ac<span class="line"><!---->  Array cookie:            ac<!----></span><br>  Intra object redzone:    bb<span class="line"><!---->  Intra object redzone:    bb<!----></span><br>  ASan internal:           fe<span class="line"><!---->  ASan internal:           fe<!----></span><br>  Left alloca redzone:     ca<span class="line"><!---->  Left alloca redzone:     ca<!----></span><br>  Right alloca redzone:    cb<span class="line"><!---->  Right alloca redzone:    cb<!----></span><br>  Shadow gap:              cc<span class="line"><!---->  Shadow gap:              cc<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: any <span class="line"><!---->Operating System: any <!----></span><br><br>I tested the asan-linux-release-812852 chrome.<span class="line"><!---->I tested the asan-linux-release-812852 chrome.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>index.html<span class="line"><!---->index.html<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;script&gt;<!----></span><br>let ab;<span class="line"><!---->let ab;<!----></span><br>async function main() {<span class="line"><!---->async function main() {<!----></span><br>	await fetch("random").then(x => x.body.getReader().read().then(y=>ab=y.value.buffer));<span class="line"><!---->	await fetch("random").then(x =&gt; x.body.getReader().read().then(y=&gt;ab=y.value.buffer));<!----></span><br>	Object.defineProperty(Object.prototype, "then", { get() {<span class="line"><!---->	Object.defineProperty(Object.prototype, "then", { get() {<!----></span><br>		var ab2 = new ArrayBuffer(0);<span class="line"><!---->		var ab2 = new ArrayBuffer(0);<!----></span><br>		try{<span class="line"><!---->		try{<!----></span><br>			postMessage("", "youngjoo", [ab]);<span class="line"><!---->			postMessage("", "youngjoo", [ab]);<!----></span><br>		} catch(e) {<span class="line"><!---->		} catch(e) {<!----></span><br>			console.log("free");<span class="line"><!---->			console.log("free");<!----></span><br>		}<span class="line"><!---->		}<!----></span><br>	}});<span class="line"><!---->	}});<!----></span><br>	var input = new Uint8Array(ab);<span class="line"><!---->	var input = new Uint8Array(ab);<!----></span><br>	console.log(ab.length);<span class="line"><!---->	console.log(ab.length);<!----></span><br>	const cs = new CompressionStream('deflate');<span class="line"><!---->	const cs = new CompressionStream('deflate');<!----></span><br>	const writer = cs.writable.getWriter();<span class="line"><!---->	const writer = cs.writable.getWriter();<!----></span><br>	writer.write(input);<span class="line"><!---->	writer.write(input);<!----></span><br>	writer.close();<span class="line"><!---->	writer.close();<!----></span><br>	const output = [];<span class="line"><!---->	const output = [];<!----></span><br>	const reader = cs.readable.getReader();<span class="line"><!---->	const reader = cs.readable.getReader();<!----></span><br>	console.log(reader);<span class="line"><!---->	console.log(reader);<!----></span><br>	var { value, done } = await reader.read();<span class="line"><!---->	var { value, done } = await reader.read();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>main();<span class="line"><!---->main();<!----></span><br></script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>randomfile.py<span class="line"><!---->randomfile.py<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>with open('/dev/urandom', 'rb') as f:<span class="line"><!---->with open('/dev/urandom', 'rb') as f:<!----></span><br>    random = f.read(0x40000)<span class="line"><!---->    random = f.read(0x40000)<!----></span><br>with open('./random', 'wb') as f:<span class="line"><!---->with open('./random', 'wb') as f:<!----></span><br>    f.write(random)<span class="line"><!---->    f.write(random)<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b         Interesting. I think we can copy the input data before the enqueue if and only if there are still bytes left to process. This will avoid the overhead of copying in the normal case.<span class="line"><!---->Interesting. I think we can copy the input data before the enqueue if and only if there are still bytes left to process. This will avoid the overhead of copying in the normal case.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Unreproducible
          
          <br>

      </div><br>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539<!----></a><br>Commit-Queue: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Reviewed-by: Yutaka Hirano <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Yutaka Hirano &lt;<!----></span>yhirano@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yhirano@chromium.org"><!---->yhirano@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/master@{#833659}<span <!----></span>https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/compression/deflate_transformer.cc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/compression/deflate_transformer.cc"><!---->https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/compression/deflate_transformer.cc<!----></a><br>[modify]         This bug requires manual review: M88's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: M88's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <span class="line"><!---->8. Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? See Eng Prod ownership by component: <!----></span>http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->http://go/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br><br>Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<span class="line"><!---->Please contact the milestone owner if you have questions.<!----></span><br>Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), dgagnon@(ChromeOS), srinivassista @(Desktop)<span class="line"><!---->Owners: govind@(Android), bindusuvarna@(iOS), dgagnon@(ChromeOS), srinivassista @(Desktop)<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         ricea@ re <span class="line"><!---->ricea@ re <!----></span>#c13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c13"><!---->#c13<!----></a> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<span class="line"><!----> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<span class="line"><!---->Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<!----></span><br>Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<span class="line"><!---->Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<!----></span><br>This blog describes a similar exploit : <span class="line"><!---->This blog describes a similar exploit : <!----></span>https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/"><!---->https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539<!----></a><br>Commit-Queue: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Reviewed-by: Yutaka Hirano <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Yutaka Hirano &lt;<!----></span>yhirano@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/yhirano@chromium.org"><!---->yhirano@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Cr-Original-Commit-Position: refs/heads/master@{#833659}<span         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd"><!---->849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Sat Jan 09 20:35:34 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Sat Jan 09 20:35:34 2021<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539<!----></a><br>Commit-Queue: Adam Rice <<span            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }

        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/compression/deflate_transformer.cc;l=55<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/compression/deflate_transformer.cc;l=55"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/compression/deflate_transformer.cc;l=55<!----></a><br>ScriptPromise DeflateTransformer::Transform(<span class="line"><!---->ScriptPromise DeflateTransformer::Transform(<!----></span><br>    v8::Local<v8::Value> chunk,<span class="line"><!---->    v8::Local&lt;v8::Value&gt; chunk,<!----></span><br>    TransformStreamDefaultController* controller,<span class="line"><!---->    TransformStreamDefaultController* controller,<!----></span><br>    ExceptionState& exception_state) {<span class="line"><!---->    ExceptionState&amp; exception_state) {<!----></span><br>  ArrayBufferOrArrayBufferView buffer_source;<span class="line"><!---->  ArrayBufferOrArrayBufferView buffer_source;<!----></span><br>  V8ArrayBufferOrArrayBufferView::ToImpl(<span class="line"><!---->  V8ArrayBufferOrArrayBufferView::ToImpl(<!----></span><br>      script_state_->GetIsolate(), chunk, buffer_source,<span class="line"><!---->      script_state_-&gt;GetIsolate(), chunk, buffer_source,<!----></span><br>      UnionTypeConversionMode::kNotNullable, class="line"><!---->		try{<!----></span><br>			postMessage("", "youngjoo", [ab]);<span class="line"><!---->			postMessage("", "youngjoo", [ab]);<!----></span><br>		} catch(e) {<span class="line"><!---->		} catch(e) {<!----></span><br>			console.log("free");<span class="line"><!---->			console.log("free");<!----></span><br>		}<span class="line"><!---->		}<!----></span><br>	}});<span class="line"><!---->	}});<!----></span><br>	var input = new Uint8Array(ab);<span class="line"><!---->	var input = new Uint8Array(ab);<!----></span><br>	console.log(ab.length);<span class="line"><!---->	console.log(ab.length);<!----></span><br>	const cs = new CompressionStream('deflate');<span class="line"><!---->	const cs = new CompressionStream('deflate');<!----></span><br>	const writer = cs.writable.getWriter();<span class="line"><!---->	const writer = cs.writable.getWriter();<!----></span><br>	writer.write(input);<span class="line"><!---->	writer.write(input);<!----></span><br>	writer.close();<span class="line"><!---->	writer.close();<!----></span><br>	const output = [];<span class="line"><!---->	const output = [];<!----></span><br>	const reader = cs.readable.getReader();<span class="line"><!---->	const reader = cs.readable.getReader();<!----></span><br>	console.log(reader);<span class="line"><!---->	console.log(reader);<!----></span><br>	var { value, done } = await reader.read();<span class="line"><!---->	var { value, done } = await reader.read();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>main();<span class="line"><!---->main();<!----></span><br></script><span class="line"><!---->&lt;/script&gt;<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>randomfile.py<span class="line"><!---->randomfile.py<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>with open('/dev/urandom', 'rb') as f:<span class="line"><!---->with open('/dev/urandom', 'rb') as f:<!----></span><br>    random = f.read(0x40000)<span class="line"><!---->    random = f.read(0x40000)<!----></span><br>with open('./random', 'wb') as f:<span class="line"><!---->with open('./random',         Interesting. I think we can copy the input data before the enqueue if and only if there are still bytes left to process.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539<a class="undefined" target="_blank" Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br><br>Yes.<span class="line"><!---->Yes.<!----></span><br><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br><br>No (removing request for M-87).<span class="line"><!---->No (removing request for M-87).<!----></span><br><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br><br>High severity security fix.<span class="line"><!---->High severity security fix.<!----></span><br><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br><br>No.<span class="line"><!---->No.<!----></span><br><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>N/A<span class="line"><!---->N/A<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         ricea@ re <span class="line"><!---->ricea@ re <!----></span>#c13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c13"><!---->#c13<!----></a> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<span class="line"><!----> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
