        Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<span class="line"><!---->Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<!----></span><br>Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<span class="line"><!---->Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<!----></span><br>This blog describes a similar exploit : <span class="line"><!---->This blog describes a similar exploit : <!----></span>https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/"><!---->https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539<a class="undefined" target="_blank" class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug:         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         ricea@ re <span class="line"><!---->ricea@ re <!----></span>#c13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c13"><!---->#c13<!----></a> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<span class="line"><!----> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<span class="line"><!---->Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<!----></span><br>Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<span class="line"><!---->Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<!----></span><br>This blog describes a similar exploit : <span class="line"><!---->This blog describes a similar exploit : <!----></span>https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/"><!---->https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"             Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

[1][2]<span class="line"><!---->|DeflateTransformer::Transform| calls |DeflateTransformer::Deflate| with the ArrayBuffer's backing store pointer. [1][2]<!----></span><br>The loop of |DeflateTransformer::Deflate| is repeated if |stream_.avail_out| is not zero. And if |bytes| is not 0, <span class="line"><!---->The loop of |DeflateTransformer::Deflate| is repeated if |stream_.avail_out| is not zero. And if |bytes| is not 0, <!----></span><br>|controller->enqueue| function is called. [3]<span class="line"><!---->|controller-&gt;enqueue| function is called. [3]<!----></span><br><br>However, when |controller->enqueue| function is called, the |Promise::Resolver::Resolve| function can be called [4]<span class="line"><!---->However, when |controller-&gt;enqueue| function is called, the |Promise::Resolver::Resolve| function can be called [4]<!----></span><br>and our javascript can be executed by defining the property accessor of 'then'. So we can free the arraybuffer during the loop <span class="line"><!---->and our javascript can be executed by defining the property accessor of 'then'. So we can free the arraybuffer during the loop <!----></span><br>and this leads to Use-After-Free.<span class="line"><!---->and this leads to Use-After-Free.<!----></span><br><br>asan log<span         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug:         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id:         ricea@ re <span class="line"><!---->ricea@ re <!----></span>#c13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c13"><!---->#c13<!----></a> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<span class="line"><!----> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<span class="line"><!---->Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<!----></span><br>Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<span class="line"><!---->Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<!----></span><br>This blog describes a similar exploit : <span class="line"><!---->This blog describes a similar exploit : <!----></span>https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/"><!---->https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd"><!---->849437efa442be8b988ce6b2f7b0b07f2c54cfcd<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Sat Jan 09 20:35:34 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Sat Jan 09 20:35:34 2021<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a         ricea@ re <span class="line"><!---->ricea@ re <!----></span>#c13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c13"><!---->#c13<!----></a> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<span class="line"><!----> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<span class="line"><!---->Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<!----></span><br>Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<span class="line"><!---->Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<!----></span><br>This blog describes a similar exploit : <span class="line"><!---->This blog describes a similar exploit : <!----></span>https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/"><!---->https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY exception_state);<span class="line"><!---->      UnionTypeConversionMode::kNotNullable, exception_state);<!----></span><br>  if (exception_state.HadException()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (exception_state.HadException()) {<!----></span><br>    return ScriptPromise();<span class="line"><!---->    return ScriptPromise();<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  if (buffer_source.IsArrayBufferView()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (buffer_source.IsArrayBufferView()) {<!----></span><br>    const auto* view = buffer_source.GetAsArrayBufferView().View();<span class="line"><!---->    const auto* view = buffer_source.GetAsArrayBufferView().View();<!----></span><br>    const uint8_t* start = static_cast<const uint8_t*>(view->BaseAddress()); ------------------ [1]<span class="line"><!---->    const uint8_t* start = static_cast&lt;const uint8_t*&gt;(view-&gt;BaseAddress()); ------------------ [1]<!----></span><br>    size_t length = view->byteLength();<span class="line"><!---->    size_t length = view-&gt;byteLength();<!----></span><br>    if (length > std::numeric_limits<wtf_size_t>::max()) {<span class="line"><!---->    if (length &gt; exception_state);<span class="line"><!---->            controller, exception_state);<!----></span><br>    return ScriptPromise::CastUndefined(script_state_);<span class="line"><!---->    return class="line"><!---->randomfile.py<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>with open('/dev/urandom', 'rb') as f:<span class="line"><!---->with open('/dev/urandom', 'rb') as f:<!----></span><br>    random = f.read(0x40000)<span class="line"><!---->    random = f.read(0x40000)<!----></span><br>with open('./random', 'wb') as f:<span class="line"><!---->with open('./random', 'wb') as f:<!----></span><br>    f.write(random)<span class="line"><!---->    f.write(random)<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: YoungJoo Lee(@ashuu_lee) of Raon Whitehat<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: YoungJoo Lee(@ashuu_lee) of Raon Whitehat<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Detailed Report: <span class="line"><!---->Detailed Report: <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5643388524494848<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5643388524494848"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5643388524494848<!----></a><br><br>Fuzzer: None<span class="line"><!---->Fuzzer: None<!----></span><br>Job Type: linux_asan_chrome_mp<span class="line"><!---->Job Type: linux_asan_chrome_mp<!----></span><br>Platform Id: linux<span class="line"><!---->Platform Id: linux<!----></span><br><br>Crash Type: CHECK failure<span class="line"><!---->Crash Type: CHECK failure<!----></span><br>Crash Address: <span class="line"><!---->Crash Address: <!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br>  r. Sending zygote magic failed in zygote_linux.cc<span class="line"><!---->  r. Sending zygote magic failed in zygote_linux.cc<!----></span><br>  content::Zygote::ProcessRequests<span class="line"><!---->  content::Zygote::ProcessRequests<!----></span><br>  content::ZygoteMain<span class="line"><!---->  content::ZygoteMain<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span><br>Sanitizer: address (ASAN)<span class="line"><!---->Sanitizer: address (ASAN)<!----></span><br><br>Crash Revision: <span class="line"><!---->Crash Revision: <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=linux_asan_chrome_mp&revision=829777<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=linux_asan_chrome_mp&amp;revision=829777"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=linux_asan_chrome_mp&amp;revision=829777<!----></a><br><br>Reproducer Testcase: <span class="line"><!---->Reproducer Testcase: <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5643388524494848<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5643388524494848"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5643388524494848<!----></a><br><br>Additional requirements: Requires HTTP<span class="line"><!---->Additional requirements: Requires HTTP<!----></span><br><br>The reproduce tool requires a ClusterFuzz source checkout.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 04 10:19:12 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567539<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         This is a read-only UAF and as such is relatively hard to turn into a privilege escalation. As such I'm not planning to request a merge to beta or stable.<span class="line"><!---->This is a read-only UAF and as such is relatively hard to turn into a privilege escalation. As such I'm not planning to request a merge to beta or stable.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2"><!---->53330915663c715cafe99bf690ea6264edad7ed2<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Dec 10 23:28:47 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         ricea@ re <span class="line"><!---->ricea@ re <!----></span>#c13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c13"><!---->#c13<!----></a> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<span class="line"><!----> could you expand on why this is hard to exploit? A read UaF can be fully exploitable especially if (for instance) it can involve reading vtable pointers or any other code addresses. If you're absolutely sure that this UaF can only ever read pure data, never even pointers or buffer lengths... I possibly agree and if so we should downgrade this to medium. But otherwise, it remains High, and as such we'd normally aim to merge back to M87. Labelling as such, so I don't overlook it next time I do some M87 merge approvals. The VRP will take a look at this on Wednesday so we'll get more opinions in the mix there too.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<span class="line"><!---->Hello, I am YoungJoo, the bug reporter. I think it can be use to leak the useful memory on 32bit Chrome(Windows, Android)<!----></span><br>Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<span class="line"><!---->Because we can use gc to unmap the freed memory region and remap it with Heap Spray.<!----></span><br>This blog describes a similar exploit : <span class="line"><!---->This blog describes a similar exploit : <!----></span>https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/"><!---->https://blog.exodusintel.com/2019/03/20/cve-2019-5786-analysis-and-exploitation/<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc"><!---->895c73c58a7cecc5557cbf0ea49c5782f22dd1fc<!----></a><br>Author: Adam Rice <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Adam Rice &lt;<!----></span>ricea@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/ricea@chromium.org"><!---->ricea@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Dec 18 04:10:34 2020<!----></span><br><br>Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<span class="line"><!---->Correctly handle detach during (de)compression<!----></span><br><br>Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<span class="line"><!---->Sometimes CompressionStream and DecompressionStream enqueue multiple<!----></span><br>output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d"><!---->4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1151298<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1151298" title="Security: Use-After-Free in DeflateTransformer"><!---->Bug: 1151298<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I03fca26fc641d54b09067e3994b76ee8efca6839<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: When this happens, JavaScript<span class="line"><!---->output chunks for a single input chunk. When this happens, JavaScript<!----></span><br>code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<span class="line"><!---->code can detach the input ArrayBuffer while the stream is processing it.<!----></span><br>This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<span class="line"><!---->This will cause an error when zlib tries to read the buffer again<!----></span><br>afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->afterwards.<!----></span><br><br>To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<span class="line"><!---->To prevent this, buffer output chunks until the entire input chunk has<!----></span><br>been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<span class="line"><!---->been processed, and then enqueue them all at once.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>4794770cf175e3bb9425c64a6d196e07392cd34d<a class="undefined" target="_blank"            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

        for LitElement.

        <h3 class="medium-heading">Convert issue to new template structure</h3>
        <form id="convertIssueForm">

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
